result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory J Borgwardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 of case no. 15-CF-12.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact direct or indirect with victims. Not to write any checks.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory J Borgwardt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cory J Borgwardt in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Cory J Borgwardt in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Cory J Borgwardt appeared by video conference from Oshkosh Correctional Institution. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that plea/sentencing be scheduled in about 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
from DA's office requesting that case be adjourned and rescheduled from 5/29. Per Court, ok.
from State requesting rescheduling, requesting video conference from Dodge. Per Court, ok.

Defendant Cory J Borgwardt in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Cory J Borgwardt in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests status conference. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
